page.title: 05CHAPEL AND INN
page.content: Hope Methodist Chapel stands on the hill at the south end of the village. It was built in 1843. The inside has recently been restored and has a main room with a carpet, organ and pews, a Sunday school room and a kitchen. Outside, stones set in the wall represent the congregation, visitors, Sunday school, war memorial and circuit. The regular attendance averages 20 adults, with 7 children in the Sunday school. The Torridge Inn sells all types of drinks, and meals and bar snacks. It holds 160 people but attracts 50 to 60 on a normal weekend. 6 bedrooms are available for letting. There are facilities for pool,skittles and darts a fruit machine, video game and juke box.The skittle club is based there. The staff comprise the owner, his wife and kitchen and bar assistants.
